timeline.bodyText: I don't think this needs a route prefix. Having everything nested under user doesn't add any value, and lets us use user in the "manage user" module
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: I have changed the path to 'admin' and I need SiteCoordinatorModule as a parent module for all nested modules to write common header in SiteCoordinatorComponent and SiteCoordinatorModule will behave as role based module so that in future if new role come we can create new module
replies.author: firdosebtc1

replies.bodyText: Let's not overdesign this for something that might or might not happen. I can be convinced to use a prefix here, but then it has to reflect the specific purpose, so 'coordinator', or rename the site-coordinator module to Admin.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: path: 'account/setup'? Do we have other account routes?
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText:
I have imported set-up-account in app.module.ts and provided routing for it in app.routing.ts to as set up account will be not be called AuthGuard
I will be making AUthGuard PR once Login will be implemented
replies.author: firdosebtc1

replies.bodyText: I don't understand. If this is being replaced than remove it from this PR
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: This will not be replaced in the future PR.
replies.author: firdosebtc1

timeline.bodyText: Why add another route? If this module only does one thing than just keep the empty path.

replies.bodyText: The REST convention is to use plurals for collections. As I said, it should be sites not site.
